## Summary
This PR enhances the FVM install script with several robustness improvements to handle edge cases and improve compatibility across different environments.

## Changes Made

### Version Handling
- Added robust version/tag normalization to handle both `v3.2.1` and `3.2.1` formats
- Implemented fallback URL strategies with HEAD checks to prevent 404 errors
- Improved version detection for latest releases

### Alpine Linux Support  
- Added musl detection via `ldd --version` to automatically select musl builds
- Ensures proper binary compatibility on Alpine containers

### User Experience Improvements
- Fixed Fish shell PATH syntax to use `set -gx PATH` instead of incorrect format
- Auto-create `/usr/local/bin` directory with privilege escalation when missing
- Enhanced error messages and validation

### Safety & Security
- Improved uninstall logic to only remove symlinks pointing to managed FVM installations
- Added expanded required tools validation
- Implemented proper temporary download directory with cleanup
- Added `chmod +x` to ensure binary executability

### Testing
- Added Alpine Linux CI job to validate musl support and installation
- All existing tests continue to pass
- Shellcheck validation clean

## Compatibility
- ✅ No breaking changes to public API
- ✅ All existing usage patterns preserved
- ✅ Backward compatible with current installations

## Testing
Validated with:
- Local root detection tests
- Script parity validation  
- Shellcheck analysis
- Basic functionality testing

Version bumped to 1.1.1 to reflect the improvements.
